ACTUATOR1_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

ACTUATOR2_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

ACTUATOR3_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

ACTUATOR4_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

ACTUATOR5_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

ACTUATOR6_INC.Description: Initial increment step for changing the actuator's PWM

AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.
AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.
AHRS_GPS_USE.DisplayName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down

Values.2: Use GPS for DCM position and height

AHRS_OPTIONS.Description: This controls optional AHRS behaviour. Setting DisableDCMFallbackFW will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in fly-forward flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DisableDCMFallbackVTOL will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in non fly-forward (VTOL) flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DontDisableAirspeedUsingEKF disables the EKF based innovation check for airspeed consistency

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor by clipping it to groundspeed plus/minus this limit. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_WIND_MAX to disable airspeed sensors.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AIS_LIST_MAX.Description: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

AIS_TIME_OUT.Description: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_CRSDP_IGN.Description: Must have value "1" if crashdump data is present on the system, or a prearm failure will be raised.  Do not set this parameter unless the risks of doing so are fully understood.  The presence of a crash dump means that the firmware currently installed has suffered a critical software failure which resulted in the autopilot immediately rebooting.  The crashdump file gives diagnostic information which can help in finding the issue, please contact the ArduPIlot support team.  If this crashdump data is present, the vehicle is likely unsafe to fly.  Check the ArduPilot documentation for more details.

ARMING_MAGTHRESH.Description: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model.  X and y axis are compared using this threhold, Z axis uses 2x this threshold.  0 to disable check
ARMING_MAGTHRESH.DisplayName: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model

ARMING_MIS_ITEMS.Description: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

Bitmask.1: Do not send status text on state change
Bitmask.2: Skip IMU consistency checks when ICE motor running

ARMING_OPTIONS.Description: Options that can be applied to change arming behaviour

ARMING_SKIPCHK.Description: Checks to skip prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks before allowing arming that will be skipped. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 0 (no checks skipped). In extreme circumstances, a value of -1 can be used to skip all non-mandatory current and future checks.

ARSPD_OPTIONS.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD_WIND_GATE.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle.

ARSPD_WIND_MAX.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD_WIND_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference

ARSPD_WIND_WARN.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD_WIND_WARN.DisplayName: Airspeed and GPS speed difference that gives a warning

ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.Description: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.
ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.DisplayName: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD2_BUS.Description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

ARSPD2_DEVID.Description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD2_PIN.Description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.Description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device
ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.DisplayName: The PSI range of the device

ARSPD2_RATIO.Description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration or requiring a manual calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.
ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.DisplayName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup

Values.1: Do not require offset calibration before flight. Manual calibration should be performed during initial setup.
Values.2: Do not calibrate on start up. Manual calibration must be performed once per boot.

ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD2_USE.Description: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ATC_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

ATC_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain

ATC_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

ATC_LAND_P_MULT.Description: Pitch gain multiplier active when landed. A factor of 1.0 means no reduction in gain while landed. Reduce this factor to reduce ground oscitation in the pitch axis.

ATC_LAND_R_MULT.Description: Roll gain multiplier active when landed. A factor of 1.0 means no reduction in gain while landed. Reduce this factor to reduce ground oscitation in the roll axis.

ATC_LAND_Y_MULT.Description: Yaw gain multiplier active when landed. A factor of 1.0 means no reduction in gain while landed. Reduce this factor to reduce ground oscitation in the yaw axis.

ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedforward is enabled or disabled

ATC_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

ATC_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

ATC_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_PDMX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
ATC_RAT_PIT_PDMX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum

ATC_RAT_PIT_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_PDMX.Description: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
ATC_RAT_RLL_PDMX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum

ATC_RAT_RLL_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_PDMX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
ATC_RAT_YAW_PDMX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller PD sum maximum

ATC_RAT_YAW_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in RTL and Auto flight modes

ATC_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

AVOID_ACCEL_MAX.Description: Maximum acceleration with which obstacles will be avoided with. Set zero to disable acceleration limits

AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.Description: Distance beyond AVOID_MARGIN parameter, after which vehicle will backaway from obstacles. Increase this parameter if you see vehicle going back and forth in front of obstacle.
AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.DisplayName: Avoidance deadzone between stopping and backing away from obstacle

AVOID_BACKUP_SPD.Description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles horizontally in position control modes (m/s). Set zero to disable horizontal backup.

AVOID_BACKZ_SPD.Description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles vertically in height control modes (m/s). Set zero to disable vertical backup.

AVOID_MARGIN.Description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes
AVOID_MARGIN.DisplayName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes

BARO1_DEVID.Description: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO1_THST_SCALE.Description: Thrust scaling in Pascals. This value scaled by the normalized thrust is subtracted from the barometer pressure. This is used to adjust linearly based on the thrust output for local pressure difference induced by the props.

BARO2_DEVID.Description: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO3_DEVID.Description: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO_ALTERR_MAX.Description: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

BARO_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

BARO_EXT_BUS.Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the BARO_PROBE_EXT parameter.

BARO_FIELD_ELV.Description: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. Changes to this parameter will only be used when disarmed. A value of 0 means the EKF origin height is used for takeoff height above sea level.

BARO_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.
BARO_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted

BARO_GND_TEMP.Description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

BARO_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

BARO_PROBE_EXT.Description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on BARO_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in BARO_EXT_BUS.

BARO_SPEC_GRAV.Description: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

BARO1_WCF_BCK.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_BCK.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)

BARO1_WCF_DN.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_DN.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)

BARO1_WCF_ENABLE.Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO1_WCF_FWD.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_FWD.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)

BARO1_WCF_LFT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_LFT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)

BARO1_WCF_RGT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_RGT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)

BARO1_WCF_UP.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_UP.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

BATT2_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2_ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT2_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT2_CHANNEL.Description: INA3221 channel to return data for

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

BATT2_ESC_INDEX.Description: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.
BATT2_ESC_INDEX.DisplayName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to

BATT2_ESC_MASK.Description: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

BATT2_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATT2_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

BATT2_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT2_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT2_I2C_ADDR.Description: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

BATT2_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT2_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_MAX_AMPS.Description: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

BATT2_MAX_VOLT.Description: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.1: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Bitmask.10: Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap
Bitmask.6: Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Bitmask.7: Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Bitmask.8: Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Bitmask.9: Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average

BATT2_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT2_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT2_SHUNT.Description: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

BATT2_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT2_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.
BATT2_VOLT_PIN.DisplayName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic

BATT4_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

BATT4_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT4_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

BATT4_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT4_I2C_ADDR.Description: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

BATT4_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT4_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_MAX_AMPS.Description: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

BATT4_MAX_VOLT.Description: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

BATT4_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.1: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Bitmask.10: Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap
Bitmask.6: Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Bitmask.7: Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Bitmask.8: Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Bitmask.9: Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average

BATT4_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT4_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT4_SHUNT.Description: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

BATT4_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT4_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT4_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

BATT4_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.
BATT4_VOLT_PIN.DisplayName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic

BATT5_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

BATT9_I2C_ADDR.Description: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

BATT9_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT9_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT9_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT9_MAX_AMPS.Description: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

BATT9_MAX_VOLT.Description: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

BATT9_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.1: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Bitmask.10: Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap
Bitmask.6: Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Bitmask.7: Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Bitmask.8: Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Bitmask.9: Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average

BATT9_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT9_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT9_SHUNT.Description: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

BATT9_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT9_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT9_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT9_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

BATT9_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.
BATT9_VOLT_PIN.DisplayName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic

BATTA_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATTA_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

BATTA_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTA_ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATTA_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATTA_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATTA_CHANNEL.Description: INA3221 channel to return data for

BATTA_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTA_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATTA_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTA_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTA_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATTA_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATTA_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

BATTA_ESC_INDEX.Description: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.
BATTA_ESC_INDEX.DisplayName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to

BATTA_ESC_MASK.Description: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

BATTA_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATTA_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

BATTA_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATTA_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATTA_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATTA_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

Bitmask.6: Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Bitmask.7: Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Bitmask.8: Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Bitmask.9: Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average

BATTE_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATTE_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATTE_SHUNT.Description: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

BATTE_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATTE_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATTE_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTE_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

BATTE_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.
BATTE_VOLT_PIN.DisplayName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic

BATTF_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATTF_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

BATTF_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTF_ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATTF_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATTF_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATTF_CHANNEL.Description: INA3221 channel to return data for

BATTF_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATTF_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTF_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATTF_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATTF_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

BATTF_ESC_INDEX.Description: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.
BATTF_ESC_INDEX.DisplayName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to

BATTF_ESC_MASK.Description: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

BATTF_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATTF_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

BATTF_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATTF_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATTF_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATTF_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

BATTF_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATTF_I2C_ADDR.Description: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

BATTF_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATTF_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATTF_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTF_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATTF_MAX_AMPS.Description: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

BATTF_MAX_VOLT.Description: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

BATTF_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.10: Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap
Bitmask.6: Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Bitmask.7: Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Bitmask.8: Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Bitmask.9: Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average

BRD_ALT_CONFIG.Description: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

BRD_BOOT_DELAY.Description: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

BRD_HEAT_LOWMGN.Description: Arming check will fail if temp is lower than this margin below BRD_HEAT_TARG. 0 disables the low temperature check

BRD_HEAT_TARG.Description: Board heater target temperature for boards with controllable heating units. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

BRD_IDLE_STATS.Description: Capture and calculate true CPU load using idle threads
BRD_IDLE_STATS.DisplayName: Capture and calculate true CPU load using idle threads

BRD_IO_DSHOT.Description: This loads the DShot firmware on the IO co-processor

BRD_IO_ENABLE.Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on boards with an IOMCU to be disabled. Setting to 2 will enable the IOMCU but not attempt to update firmware on startup

Bitmask.5: Write protect firmware flash on reboot
Bitmask.6: Write protect bootloader flash on reboot
Bitmask.8: Disable board arming gpio output change on arm/disarm

BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL.Description: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output. On boards with an IOMCU that support this parameter this option only affects the 8 main outputs, not the 6 auxiliary outputs. Using 5V output can help to reduce the impact of ESC noise interference corrupting signals to the ESCs.

Bitmask.3: Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Description: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed

BRD_SAFETY_DEFLT.Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.
BRD_SAFETY_DEFLT.DisplayName: Sets default state of the safety switch

BRD_SAFETY_MASK.Description: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed
BRD_SAFETY_MASK.DisplayName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state

BRD_SBUS_OUT.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

BRD_SD_FENCE.Description: This sets the amount of storage in kilobytes reserved on the microsd card in fence.stg for fence storage.

BRD_SD_MISSION.Description: This sets the amount of storage in kilobytes reserved on the microsd card in mission.stg for waypoint storage. Each waypoint uses 15 bytes.

BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN.Description: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER3_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER4_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER5_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER6_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 6. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER7_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 7. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SER8_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 8. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

BRD_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

BRD_VBUS_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

BRD_VSERVO_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

BRD_RADIO_ABLVL.Description: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

BRD_RADIO_ABTIME.Description: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

BRD_RADIO_BZOFS.Description: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.Description: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled
BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.DisplayName: Put radio into FCC test mode

BRD_RADIO_PPSCH.Description: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_SIGCH.Description: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_STKMD.Description: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

BRD_RADIO_TELEM.Description: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.Description: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.
BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.DisplayName: Set radio to factory test channel

BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX
BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.DisplayName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter

BRD_RADIO_TXMAX.Description: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

BRD_RADIO_TXPOW.Description: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

BRD_RADIO_TYPE.Description: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers
BRD_RADIO_TYPE.DisplayName: Set type of direct attached radio

BRD_RTC_TYPES.Description: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN.Description: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

BTN0_SFUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function
BTN0_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on

CAM_AUTO_ONLY.Description: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

CAM_MAX_ROLL.Description: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

CAM1_DURATION.Description: Duration in seconds that the camera shutter is held open

CAM1_FEEDBAK_PIN.Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection.  Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot. See also the CAMx_FEEDBCK_POL option.

CAM1_FEEDBAK_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

CAM1_HFOV.Description: Camera horizontal field of view. 0 if unknown

CAM1_INTRVAL_MIN.Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than this many seconds ago
CAM1_INTRVAL_MIN.DisplayName: Camera minimum time interval between photos

CAM1_MNT_INST.Description: Mount instance camera is associated with. 0 means camera and mount have identical instance numbers e.g. camera1 and mount1

Bitmask.0: Recording Starts at arming and stops at disarming

CAM1_RELAY_ON.Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

CAM1_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM1_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM1_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

CAM1_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAM1_VFOV.Description: Camera vertical field of view. 0 if unknown

CAM1_RC_BTN_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM1_RC_BTN_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses

CAM1_RC_BT_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM1_RC_BT_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates

CAM1_RC_CONTROL.Description: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu and other option like autorecording

CAM1_RC_FEATURES.Description: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.

CAM1_RC_MDE_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM1_RC_MDE_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses

CAM1_RC_TYPE.Description: RunCam device type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

CAM2_DURATION.Description: Duration in seconds that the camera shutter is held open

CAM2_FEEDBAK_PIN.Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection.  Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot. See also the CAMx_FEEDBCK_POL option.

CAM2_FEEDBAK_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

CAM2_HFOV.Description: Camera horizontal field of view. 0 if unknown

CAM2_INTRVAL_MIN.Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than this many seconds ago
CAM2_INTRVAL_MIN.DisplayName: Camera minimum time interval between photos

CAM2_MNT_INST.Description: Mount instance camera is associated with. 0 means camera and mount have identical instance numbers e.g. camera1 and mount1

Bitmask.0: Recording Starts at arming and stops at disarming

CAM2_RELAY_ON.Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

CAM2_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM2_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM2_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

CAM2_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAM2_VFOV.Description: Camera vertical field of view. 0 if unknown

CAM2_RC_BTN_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM2_RC_BTN_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses

CAM2_RC_BT_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM2_RC_BT_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates

CAM2_RC_CONTROL.Description: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu and other option like autorecording

CAM2_RC_FEATURES.Description: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.

CAM2_RC_MDE_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM2_RC_MDE_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses

CAM2_RC_TYPE.Description: RunCam device type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

CAN_LOGLEVEL.Description: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver
CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver

CAN_D1_PROTOCOL2.Description: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing
CAN_D1_PROTOCOL2.DisplayName: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing

CAN_D1_PC_ECU_ID.Description: Node ID to send ECU throttle messages to. Set to zero to disable ECU throttle messages. Set to 255 to broadcast to all ECUs.

CAN_D1_PC_ECU_RT.Description: Output rate of ECU command messages

CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM.Description: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT.Description: Output rate of ESC command messages

CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM.Description: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT.Description: Output rate of servo command messages

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over DroneCAN
CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: Output channels to be transmitted as ESC over DroneCAN

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_OF.Description: Offset for ESC numbering in DroneCAN ESC RawCommand messages. This allows for more efficient packing of ESC command messages. If your ESCs are on servo outputs 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficient usage of CAN bandwidth

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_RV.Description: Bitmask with one set for each output channel that uses a reversible ESC over DroneCAN. Reversible ESCs use both positive and negative values in RawCommands, with positive commanding the forward direction and negative commanding the reverse direction.
CAN_D1_UC_ESC_RV.DisplayName: Bitmask for output channels for reversible ESCs over DroneCAN.

CAN_D1_UC_NODE.Description: DroneCAN node ID used by the driver itself on this network

CAN_D1_UC_NTF_RT.Description: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

CAN_D1_UC_POOL.Description: Amount of memory in bytes to allocate for the DroneCAN memory pool. More memory is needed for higher CAN bus loads

CAN_D1_UC_RLY_RT.Description: Maximum transmit rate for relay outputs, note that this rate is per message each message does 1 relay, so if with more relays will take longer to update at the same rate, a extra message will be sent when a relay changes state

CAN_D1_UC_S1_BD.Description: Serial baud rate on remote CAN node

CAN_D1_UC_S1_IDX.Description: Serial port number on remote CAN node

CAN_D1_UC_S1_NOD.Description: CAN remote node number for serial port

CAN_D1_UC_S1_PRO.Description: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port
CAN_D1_UC_S1_PRO.DisplayName: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port

CAN_P1_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P1_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.
CAN_P1_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface

CAN_P1_FDBITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

CAN_P2_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P2_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.
CAN_P2_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface

CAN_P2_FDBITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

CAN_P3_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P3_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.
CAN_P3_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface

CAN_P3_FDBITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

CAN_SLCAN_CPORT.Description: CAN Interface ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

CAN_SLCAN_SDELAY.Description: Duration after which slcan starts after setting SERNUM in seconds.

CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM.Description: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT.Description: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original driver in seconds.

Bitmask.2: Start at center rather than on perimeter
Bitmask.3: Make Mount ROI the center of the circle

CIRCLE_OPTIONS.Description: 0:Enable or disable using the pitch/roll stick control circle mode's radius and rate

CIRCLE_RADIUS_M.Description: Radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

CIRCLE_RATE.Description: Circle mode's maximum turn rate in deg/sec.  Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise. Final circle rate is also limited by speed and acceleration settings.

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_AUTO_ROT.Description: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

Values.3: use same tolerance to auto rotate 45 deg rotations

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_CUS_PIT.Description: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_ROLL.Description: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_YAW.Description: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID4.Description: Extra 4th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID5.Description: Extra 5th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID6.Description: Extra 6th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID7.Description: Extra 7th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID8.Description: Extra 8th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DISBLMSK.Description: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

COMPASS_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.
COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current.  Do not change manually.

COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]
