GPS2_MB_OFS_X.Description: X position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive X is forward of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_X.

GPS2_MB_OFS_Y.Description: Y position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Y is to the right of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Y.

GPS2_MB_OFS_Z.Description: Z position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Z is down from the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Z.

GPS2_MB_TYPE.Description: Controls the type of moving base used if using moving base.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_TYPE.

GPS_MB1_OFS_X.Description: X position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive X is forward of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_X.

GPS_MB1_OFS_Y.Description: Y position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Y is to the right of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Y.

GPS_MB1_OFS_Z.Description: Z position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Z is down from the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Z.

GPS_MB1_TYPE.Description: Controls the type of moving base used if using moving base.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_TYPE.

GPS_MB2_OFS_X.Description: X position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive X is forward of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_X.

GPS_MB2_OFS_Y.Description: Y position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Y is to the right of the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Y.

GPS_MB2_OFS_Z.Description: Z position of the base (primary) GPS antenna in body frame from the position of the 2nd antenna. Positive Z is down from the 2nd antenna. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_OFS_Z.

GPS_MB2_TYPE.Description: Controls the type of moving base used if using moving base.This is renamed in 4.6 and later to GPSx_MB_TYPE.

GRIP_AUTOCLOSE.Description: Time in seconds that gripper close the gripper after opening; 0 to disable

GRIP_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

GRIP_NEUTRAL.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to grabber when not grabbing or releasing

GRIP_REGRAB.Description: Time in seconds that EPM gripper will regrab the cargo to ensure grip has not weakened; 0 to disable

GRIP_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

INS_ACC1_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 1st accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC2OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 2nd accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC2_ID.Description: Accelerometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC3OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 3rd accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC3_ID.Description: Accelerometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACCEL_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC_BODYFIX.Description: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

INS_ACC_ID.Description: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ENABLE_MASK.Description: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

INS_FAST_SAMPLE.Description: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

INS_GYR1_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 1st gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR2OFFS_X.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 2nd gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR2_ID.Description: Gyro2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR3OFFS_X.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 3rd gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR3_ID.Description: Gyro3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYRO_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_GYRO_RATE.Description: Gyro rate for IMUs with fast sampling enabled. The gyro rate is the sample rate at which the IMU filters operate and needs to be at least double the maximum filter frequency. If the sensor does not support the selected rate the next highest supported rate will be used. For IMUs which do not support fast sampling this setting is ignored and the default gyro rate of 1Khz is used.
INS_GYRO_RATE.DisplayName: Gyro rate for IMUs with Fast Sampling enabled

INS_GYR_CAL.Description: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

INS_GYR_ID.Description: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_X.Description: X position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Y.Description: Y position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_STILL_THRESH.Description: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5
INS_STILL_THRESH.DisplayName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving

INS_TCAL_OPTIONS.Description: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting of the Persist bits will save the temperature and/or accelerometer calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

INS_TRIM_OPTION.Description: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

Values.2: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

INS_USE.Description: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE.DisplayName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE2.Description: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE2.DisplayName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE3.Description: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE3.DisplayName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS4_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS4_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS4_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS4_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS4_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS4_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS4_ACC_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the accelerometer was calibrated at

INS4_ACC_ID.Description: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS4_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS4_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS4_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS4_GYR_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the gyroscope was calibrated at

INS4_GYR_ID.Description: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS4_POS_X.Description: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS4_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS4_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_HNTC2_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

INS_HNTC2_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

INS_HNTC2_FM_RAT.Description: The minimum ratio below the configured frequency to take throttle based notch filters when flying at a throttle level below the reference throttle. Note that lower frequency notch filters will have more phase lag. If you want throttle based notch filtering to be effective at a throttle up to 30% below the configured notch frequency then set this parameter to 0.7. The default of 1.0 means the notch will not go below the frequency in the FREQ parameter.

INS_HNTC2_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

INS_HNTC2_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of 0 disables this filter. The first harmonic refers to the base frequency.

INS_HNTC2_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based harmonic notch cannot be used on fixed wing only planes. It can for Copters, QuaadPlane(while in VTOL modes), and Rovers.
INS_HNTC2_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode

Bitmask.5: Use min freq on RPM source failure

INS_HNTC2_OPTS.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Triple and double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth with reduced latency than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Multi-Source attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz. If both double and triple notches are specified only double notches will take effect.

INS_HNTC2_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter.  For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed.  The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter.  This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required.  For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

INS_LOG_BAT_CNT.Description: Number of samples to take when logging streams of IMU sensor readings.  Will be rounded down to a multiple of 32. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

INS_LOG_BAT_LGCT.Description: Number of samples to push to count every INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN

INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN.Description: Interval between pushing samples to the AP_Logger log

INS_LOG_BAT_MASK.Description: Bitmap of which IMUs to log batch data for. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

Bitmask.0: Sensor-Rate Logging (sample at full sensor rate seen by AP)

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the block backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for block backend

LOG_DARM_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to any backend when disarmed. A value of zero means that the normal backend rate limit is applied.

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled at all times including when disarmed. Logging before arming can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues and is necessary if logging of EKF replay data is selected via the LOG_REPLAY parameter. If LOG_DISARMED is set to 2, then logging will be enabled when disarmed, but not if a USB connection is detected. This can be used to prevent unwanted data logs being generated when the vehicle is connected via USB for log downloading or parameter changes. If LOG_DISARMED is set to 3 then logging will happen while disarmed, but if the vehicle never arms then the logs using the filesystem backend will be discarded on the next boot.

Values.3: Discard log on reboot if never armed

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device.  Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging but increases memory usage.  This buffer size may be reduced to free up available memory
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Logging File and Block Backend buffer size max (in kibibytes)

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed.  If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm

LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.Description: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log
LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.DisplayName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space

LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the file backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for file backend

LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.Description: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.
LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout before giving up on file writes

LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.Description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink
LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size

LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for mavlink backend

LOG_MAX_FILES.Description: This sets the maximum number of log file that will be written on dataflash or sd card before starting to rotate log number. Limit is capped at 500 logs.

LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 and EKF3 state estimators will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. LOG_DISARMED must be set to 1 or 2 or else the log will not contain the pre-flight data required for replay testing of the EKF's. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost.
LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay

LOIT_ACC_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s.  Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

LOIT_ANG_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum pilot requested lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of PSC_ANGLE_MAX/ATC_ANGLE_MAX. The maximum vehicle lean angle is still limited by PSC_ANGLE_MAX/ATC_ANGLE_MAX

LOIT_BRK_ACCEL.Description: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

LOIT_BRK_JERK.Description: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

AEROM_ALT_ABORT.Description: Maximum allowable loss in altitude during a trick or sequence from its starting altitude.

AEROM_ANG_TC.Description: This is the time over which we filter the desired roll to smooth it

AEROM_DEBUG.Description: This controls the printing of extra debug information on paths

AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.Description: This controls how rapidly we roll into a new orientation
AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.DisplayName: The roll rate to use when entering a roll maneuver

AEROM_ERR_COR_D.Description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path
AEROM_ERR_COR_D.DisplayName: D gain for path error corrections

AEROM_ERR_COR_P.Description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path
AEROM_ERR_COR_P.DisplayName: P gain for path error corrections

AEROM_KE_RUDD.Description: Percent of rudder normally uses to sustain knife-edge at trick speed

AEROM_KE_RUDD_LK.Description: Time to look ahead in the path to calculate rudder correction for bank angle

AEROM_LKAHD.Description: This is how much time to look ahead in the path for calculating path rates

AEROM_MIS_ANGLE.Description: When set to a non-zero value, this is the assumed direction of the mission. Otherwise the waypoint angle is used

AEROM_PATH_SCALE.Description: Scale factor for Path/Box size. 0.5 would half the distances in maneuvers. Radii are unaffected.

AEROM_ROL_COR_TC.Description: This is the time constant for correcting roll errors. A smaller value leads to faster roll corrections

AEROM_SPD_I.Description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_SPD_P.Description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_STALL_PIT.Description: Pitch threashold for moving to final stage of stall turn

AEROM_STALL_THR.Description: Amount of throttle to reduce to for a stall turn

AEROM_THR_BOOST.Description: This is the extra throttle added in schedule elements marked as needing a throttle boost

AEROM_THR_LKAHD.Description: This controls how far ahead we look in time along the path for the target throttle

AEROM_THR_PIT_FF.Description: This controls how much extra throttle to add based on pitch ange. The value is for 90 degrees and is applied in proportion to pitch

AEROM_TIME_COR_P.Description: This is the time constant for correcting path position errors
AEROM_TIME_COR_P.DisplayName: Time constant for correction of our distance along the path

AEROM_TS_I.Description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_P.Description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_RATE.Description: This sets the rate we send data for time sync between aircraft
AEROM_TS_RATE.DisplayName: Timesync rate of send of NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT data

AEROM_TS_SPDMAX.Description: This sets the maximum speed adjustment for time sync between aircraft

AEROM_YAW_ACCEL.Description: This is maximum yaw acceleration to use

AHRS_ORIG_ALT.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this altitude (in meters above sea level) if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_LAT.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this latitude if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_LON.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this longitude if not already set

ALAND_WP_ALT.Description: Altitude of final approach waypoint created by script

ALAND_WP_DIST.Description: Distance from landing point (HOME) to final approach waypoint created by script in the opposite direction of initial takeoff

ARM_C_RTL_ALT_M.Description: RTL_ALT_M should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_C_RTL_ALT_M.DisplayName: RTL_ALT_M should be a valid value

ARM_ESTOP.Description: Emergency Stop disables arming. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FENCE.Description: Fences loaded but no fence enabled. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_OFS_DEF.Description: Follow offsets should not be left as default (zero) if FOLL_ENABLE = 1. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_SYSID.Description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_SYSID_X.Description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID is different to MAV_SYSID. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_MNTX_SYSID.Description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1 and MNTx_SYSID_DEFLT is set, check that FOLL_SYSID is equal MNTx. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_MNTX_SYSID.DisplayName: Follow and Mount should follow the same vehicle

ARM_P_AIRSPEED.Description: Validate that AIRSPEED_STALL(if set) < MIN < CRUISE < MAX d. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_QRTL_ALT.Description: Q_RTL_ALT should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_P_QRTL_ALT.DisplayName: Q_RTL_ALT should be a valid value

ARM_P_Q_FS_LAND.Description: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will land. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_P_Q_FS_LAND.DisplayName: Warn if Q failsafe will land

ARM_P_Q_FS_RTL.Description: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will QRTL. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_P_Q_FS_RTL.DisplayName: Warn if Q failsafe will QRTL

ARM_P_RTL_ALT.Description: RTL_ALTITITUDE should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_P_RTL_ALT.DisplayName: RTL_ALTITUDE should be a valid value

ARM_P_SCALING.Description: Validate that SCALING_SPEED is within 20% of AIRSPEED_CRUISE. If SCALING_SPEED changes the vehicle may need to be retuned. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_STALL.Description: Validate that AIRSPEED_MIN is at least 25% above AIRSPEED_STALL(if set). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_RALLY.Description: Rally Point more than RALLY_LIMIT_KM kilometers away. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_RTL_CLIMB.Description: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.
ARM_RTL_CLIMB.DisplayName: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be a valid value

ARM_SYSID.Description: Check that MAV_SYSID (or SYDID_THISMAV) has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_V_ALT_LEGAL.Description: Legal max altitude for UAV/RPAS/drones in your jurisdiction

BATT_IDX.Description: Ensure this battery is configured with `BATT*_MONITOR=29`.

BTAG_CUR_CYCLES.Description: this is the highest value for battery cycles for all connected batteries

CFACT.Description: This is multiplicative factor to correct the measured flow. Set to <1 if your sensor measures too high.

CGA_RATIO.Description: The ratio between the front and back motor outputs during steady-state hover. Positive when the CoG is in front of the motors midpoint (front motors work harder).

DIST_CUTOFF.Description: The distance from target beyond which the target is ignored

DR_ENABLE_DIST.Description: Distance from home (in meters) beyond which the dead reckoning will be enabled

DR_FLY_ALT_MIN.Description: Copter will fly at at least this altitude (in meters) above home during deadreckoning

DR_FLY_TIMEOUT.Description: Copter will attempt to switch to NEXT_MODE after this many seconds of deadreckoning.  If it cannot switch modes it will continue in Guided_NoGPS.  Set to 0 to disable timeout

DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.Description: GPS speed accuracy maximum, above which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 0.8).  Lower values trigger with good GPS quality, higher values will allow poorer GPS before triggering. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS speed accuracy
DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.DisplayName: Deadreckoning GPS speed accuracy maximum threshold

DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.Description: GPS satellite count threshold below which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 6).  Higher values trigger with good GPS quality, Lower values trigger with worse GPS quality. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS satellite count
DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.DisplayName: Deadreckoning GPS satellite count min threshold

DR_GPS_TRIGG_SEC.Description: GPS checks must fail for this many seconds before dead reckoning will be triggered

DR_NEXT_MODE.Description: Copter switch to this mode after GPS recovers or DR_FLY_TIMEOUT has elapsed.  Default is 6/RTL.  Set to -1 to return to mode used before deadreckoning was triggered

EFI_2K_CANDRV.Description: NMEA 2000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_DLA_LPS.Description: EFI DLA litres of fuel per second of injection time

EFI_H6K_CANDRV.Description: Halo6000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_H6K_FUELTOT.Description: The capacity of the tank in litres

EFI_H6K_START_FN.Description: The RC auxilliary function number for start/stop of the generator. Zero to disable start function

EFI_H6K_TELEM_RT.Description: The rate that additional generator telemetry is sent

EFI_HFE_ECU_IDX.Description: HFI EFI ECU index, 0 for automatic

EFI_HFE_FUEL_DTY.Description: HFI EFI fuel density in gram per litre

EFI_INF_IGN_AUX.Description: EFI INF throttle ignition aux function

EFI_SP_GEN_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI generator control function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling generator start/stop

EFI_SP_LOG_RT.Description: SkyPower EFI log rate. This is the rate at which extra logging of the SkyPower EFI is performed

EFI_SP_MIN_RPM.Description: SkyPower EFI minimum RPM. This is the RPM below which the engine is considered to be stopped

EFI_SP_RST_TIME.Description: SkyPower EFI restart time. If engine should be running and it has stopped for this amount of time then auto-restart. To disable this feature set this value to zero.

EFI_SP_START_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI start function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling engine start

EFI_SP_ST_DISARM.Description: SkyPower EFI allow start disarmed. This controls if starting the engine while disarmed is allowed

EFI_SP_THR_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI throttle function. This sets which SERVOn_FUNCTION to use for the target throttle. This should be 70 for fixed wing aircraft and 31 for helicopter rotor speed control

EFI_SP_THR_RATE.Description: SkyPower EFI throttle rate. This sets rate at which throttle updates are sent to the engine

EFI_SP_TLM_RT.Description: SkyPower EFI telemetry rate. This is the rate at which extra telemetry values are sent to the GCS

EFI_SVF_ARMCHECK.Description: Check for Generator ARM state before arming

ENABLE.Description: When set to 0 this script will not run. When set to 1 this script will run.

ESC_HW_OFS.Description: Motor number offset of first ESC

ESC_HW_POLES.Description: Number of motor poles for eRPM scaling

ESRC_EXTN_QUAL.Description: ExternalNav may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_EXTN_THRESH.Description: ExternalNav may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_QUAL.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_THRESH.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_RNGFND_MAX.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if rangefinder distance is below this threshold

FOLLP_ACT_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Plane Follow enable/disable

FOLLP_ALT.Description: When non zero, this altitude value (in FOLL_ALT_TYPE frame) overrides the value sent by the target vehicle

FOLLP_DIST_CLOSE.Description: When closer than this distance assume we track by heading

FOLLP_D_D.Description: D gain for the speed PID controller distance component
FOLLP_D_D.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting distance D gain

FOLLP_D_I.Description: I gain for the speed PID  distance component
FOLLP_D_I.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting distance I gain

FOLLP_D_P.Description: P gain for the speed PID controller distance component
FOLLP_D_P.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting distance P gain

FOLLP_EXIT_MODE.Description: Mode to switch to when follow mode is exited normally

FOLLP_FAIL_MODE.Description: Mode to switch to if the target is lost (no signal or > FOLL_DIST_MAX).

FOLLP_LkAHD.Description: Time to "lookahead" when calculating distance errors

FOLLP_OVRSHT_DEG.Description: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume an overshoot

FOLLP_REFRESH.Description: refresh rate for Plane Follow updates

FOLLP_SIM_TLF_FN.Description: Set this switch to simulate losing telemetry from the other vehicle
FOLLP_SIM_TLF_FN.DisplayName: Plane Follow Simulate Telemetry fail function

FOLLP_TIMEOUT.Description: How long to try reaquire a target if telemetry from the lead vehicle is lost.

FOLLP_TURN_DEG.Description: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume it's turning

FOLLP_V_D.Description: D gain for the speed PID controller velocity component
FOLLP_V_D.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting speed D gain

FOLLP_V_I.Description: I gain for the speed PID controller velocity component
FOLLP_V_I.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting speed I gain

FOLLP_V_P.Description: P gain for the speed PID controller velocity component
FOLLP_V_P.DisplayName: Plane Follow Scripting speed P gain

FOLLP_WIDE_TURNS.Description: Use wide turns when following a turning target. Alternative is "cutting the corner"

FOLLP_XT_D.Description: D term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller
FOLLP_XT_D.DisplayName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller D term

FOLLP_XT_I.Description: I term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller
FOLLP_XT_I.DisplayName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller I term

FOLLP_XT_I_MAX.Description: maximum I applied the crosstrack/heading PID controller
FOLLP_XT_I_MAX.DisplayName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum integral

FOLLP_XT_MAX.Description: maximum correction retured by the crosstrack/heading PID controller
FOLLP_XT_MAX.DisplayName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum correction

FOLLP_XT_P.Description: P term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller
FOLLP_XT_P.DisplayName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller P term

FOLT_MAV_CHAN.Description: MAVLink channel to which FOLLOW_TARGET should be sent

LTE_BAND.Description: This allows selection of LTE band. A value of -1 means no band setting change is made. A value of 0 sets all bands. Otherwise the specified band is set.

LTE_BAUD.Description: Baud rate for the serial port to the LTE modem when connected. Initial power on baudrate is in LTE_IBAUD

LTE_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable the LTE modem driver

LTE_IBAUD.Description: This is the initial baud rate on power on for the modem. This is set in the modem with the AT+IREX=baud command

LTE_MCCMNC.Description: This allows selection of network operator

LTE_OPTIONS.Description: Options to control the LTE modem driver. If VerboseSignalInfoGCS is set then additional NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT values are sent with verbose signal information

LTE_PROTOCOL.Description: The protocol that we will use in communication with the LTE modem. If this is PPP then the LTE_SERVER parameters are not used and instead a PPP connection will be established and you should use the NET_ parameters to enable network ports. If this is MAVLink2 then the LTE_SERVER parameters are used to create a TCP or UDP connection to a single server.

LTE_SCRPORT.Description: Scripting Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SCR_SDEV ports that are set to 2 for "MAVLink2"

LTE_SERPORT.Description: Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SERIALn_ ports that are set to 28 for "scripting"

LTE_SERVER_IP0.Description: First octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP1.Description: Second octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP2.Description: Third octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP3.Description: Fourth octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_PORT.Description: IPv4 Port of the server to connect to

LTE_TIMEOUT.Description: Timeout in seconds for the LTE connection. If no data is received for this time, the connection will be reset. A value of zero disables the timeout

LTE_TX_RATE.Description: Maximum data transmit rate to the modem in bytes/second. Use zero for unlimited

MODE.Description: 0: The sensor will save the fuel consumption across power resets. 1: The sensor will reset the power consumption.

PLND_ALT_CUTOFF.Description: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

POI_DIST_MAX.Description: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

PORT.Description: Which Scripting serial port the sensor is connected at.

PREV_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.Description: If while tuning the angle error goes over this limit then the tune will aborts to prevent a bad oscillation in the case of the tuning algorithm failing. If you get an error "Tuning: attitude error ABORTING" and you think it is a false positive then you can either raise this parameter or you can try increasing the QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME to do the tune more slowly. A value of zero disables this check.
QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: maximum angle error for tune abort

QUIK_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

QUIK_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME.Description: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN.Description: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

QUIK_MAX_REDUCE.Description: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

QUIK_OPTIONS.Description: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

QUIK_OSC_SMAX.Description: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

QUIK_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

QUIK_YAW_D_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw D gain

QUIK_YAW_P_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw P gain

QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

RCK_DEBUG.Description: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

RCK_ENABLE.Description: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

RCK_FORCEHL.Description: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

RCK_PERIOD.Description: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

RCK_TIMEOUT.Description: If RCK_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled
RCK_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages

RK9_BOOTED.Description: SERVOn GPIO channel that reads the Rockblock booted state. This connects to I_BTD on the Rockblock header. Requires SERVON_FUNCTION=-1

RK9_DEBUG.Description: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

RK9_ENABLE.Description: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

RK9_FORCEHL.Description: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

RK9_PERIOD.Description: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

RK9_RELAY.Description: RELAYn output to control Rockblock power. This connects to I_EN on the Rockblock header.

RK9_SCRPORT.Description: Scripting Serial port number to which the Rockblock is connected for HL2 messages This is the index of the SCR_SDEV ports that are set to 2 for "MavlinkHL"

RK9_SERPORT.Description: Serial port number to which the Rockblock is connected.This is the index of the SERIALn_ ports that are set to 28 for "scripting"

RK9_TIMEOUT.Description: If RK9_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled
RK9_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages

RTUN_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

RTUN_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

RTUN_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio

RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio

RTUN_SPEED_MIN.Description: The mimimum speed in m/s required for tuning to start
RTUN_SPEED_MIN.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune minimum speed for tuning

RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain
RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio

RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio

RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio

SHIP_AUTO_OFS.Description: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

SHIP_LAND_ANGLE.Description: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

SLUP_DEBUG.Description: Slung payload debug output, set to 1 to enable debug

SLUP_DIST_MAX.Description: Oscillation is suppressed when vehicle and payload are no more than this distance horizontally.  Set to 0 to always suppress

SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.Description: payload's position estimator's time constant used to compensate for GPS errors and wind.  Higher values result in smoother estimate but slower response
SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.DisplayName: Slung Payload resting offset estimate filter time constant

SLUP_SYSID.Description: Slung Payload mavlink system id.  0 to use any/all system ids

SLUP_VEL_P.Description: Slung Payload Velocity P gain, higher values will result in faster movements in sync with payload

SLUP_WP_POS_P.Description: WP position P gain. higher values will result in vehicle moving more quickly back to the original waypoint
SLUP_WP_POS_P.DisplayName: Slung Payload return to WP position P gain

TA_ACT_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Terrain Avoidance enable/disable

TA_ALT_MAX.Description: This is a limit on how high the terrain avoidane will take the vehicle. It acts a failsafe to prevent vertical flyaways.

TA_CMTC_ENABLE.Description: Whether to enable Can't Make That Climb while running Terrain Avoidance

TA_CMTC_HGT.Description: The minimum Height above terrain to maintain when following an AUTO mission or RTL. If zero(0) use TA_PTCH_DOW_MIN.

TA_CMTC_RAD.Description: Use this radius for the loiter when trying to gain altitude. If not set or <=0 use WP_LOITER_RAD

TA_GSP_AIRBRAKE.Description: This is the limit for triggering airbrake to slow groundspeed as a difference between the airspeed and groundspeed. -1 for disabled.

TA_GSP_MAX.Description: This is a limit on how fast in groundspeeed terrain avoidance will take the vehicle. This is to allow for reliable sensor readings. -1 for disabled.

TA_HOME_DIST.Description: Terrain avoidance will not be applied if the vehicle is less than this distance from home

TA_PTCH_DWN_MIN.Description: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

TA_PTCH_FWD_MIN.Description: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

TA_PTCH_GSP_MIN.Description: Minimum Groundspeed (not airspeed) to be flying for Pitching to be used.

TA_PTCH_TIMEOUT.Description: Minimum down or forward distance must be triggered for more than this many seconds to start Pitching

TA_QUAD_DWN_MIN.Description: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

TA_QUAD_FWD_MIN.Description: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

TERR_BRK_ALT.Description: terrain brake altitude. The altitude above the ground below which BRAKE mode will be engaged if in LOITER mode.

TERR_BRK_HDIST.Description: terrain brake home distance. The distance from home where the auto BRAKE will be enabled. When within this distance of home the script will not activate

TERR_BRK_SPD.Description: terrain brake speed threshold. Don't trigger BRAKE if both horizontal speed and descent rate are below this threshold. By setting this to a small value this can be used to allow the user to climb up to a safe altitude in LOITER mode. A value of 0.5 is recommended if you want to use LOITER to recover from an emergency terrain BRAKE mode change.

THR_KILL_CHAN.Description: output channel to change on throttle kill, a value of zero disables the feature
THR_KILL_CHAN.DisplayName: output channel to change on throttle kill

THR_KILL_DEF.Description: throttle kill default value. The default auxilliary function position on boot

THR_KILL_FUNC.Description: AUX function to kill engine. This can be activated either with a RCn_OPTION and a R/C switch or with a ground station auxilliary function

THR_KILL_VAL.Description: auxilliary value to kill throttle. Set to 2 to kill the throttle when the auxilliary is high. Set to 0 to kill when auxilliary is low

TOFSENSE_ID1.Description: First TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. Leave this at 0 to accept all IDs and if only one sensor is present. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_ID2.Description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_ID3.Description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_INST1.Description: First TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 1 will pick the first backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_INST2.Description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 2 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_INST3.Description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 3 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_MODE.Description: TOFSENSE-M mode to be used. 0 for 8x8 mode. 1 for 4x4 mode

TOFSENSE_NO.Description: Number of TOFSENSE-M CAN sensors connected

TOFSENSE_PRX.Description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)
TOFSENSE_PRX.DisplayName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor

TOFSENSE_S1_BR.Description: Serial Port baud rate. Sensor baud rate can be changed from Nassistant software

TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.Description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)
TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.DisplayName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor

TOFSENSE_S1_SP.Description: UART instance sensor is connected to. Set 1 if sensor is connected to the port with fist SERIALx_PROTOCOL = 28.

TRIK_ACT_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick action (abort,announce,execute)

TRIK_COUNT.Description: Number of tricks which can be selected over the range of the trik selection RC channel

TRIK_ENABLE.Description: Enables Tricks on Switch. TRIK params hidden until enabled

TRIK_SEL_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick selection

VID1_IPADDR0.Description: Video stream IP Address first octet

VID1_IPADDR1.Description: Video stream IP Address second octet

VID1_IPADDR2.Description: Video stream IP Address third octet

VID1_IPADDR3.Description: Video stream IP Address fourth octet

VID1_IPPORT.DisplayName: Camera1 Video Stream IP Address Port

WEB_BLOCK_SIZE.Description: web server block size for download

WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.Description: sendfile is an offloading mechanism for faster file download. If this is non-zero and the file is larger than this size then sendfile will be used for file download
WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.DisplayName: web server minimum file size for sendfile

WINCH_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control winch rate

MAV_GCS_SYSID.Description: This sets what MAVLink source system IDs are accepted for GCS failsafe handling, RC overrides and manual control. When MAV_GCS_SYSID_HI is less than MAV_GCS_SYSID then only this value is considered to be a GCS. When MAV_GCS_SYSID_HI is greater than or equal to MAV_GCS_SYSID then the range of values between MAV_GCS_SYSID and MAV_GCS_SYSID_HI (inclusive) are all treated as valid GCS MAVLink system IDs

MAV_GCS_SYSID_HI.Description: Upper limit of MAVLink source system IDs considered to be from the GCS. When this is less than MAV_GCS_SYSID then only MAV_GCS_SYSID is used as GCS ID. When this is greater than or equal to MAV_GCS_SYSID then the range of values from MAV_GCS_SYSID to MAV_GCS_SYSID_HI (inclusive) is treated as a GCS ID.

Bitmask.0: Accept MAVLink only from system IDs given by MAV_SYSID_GCS and MAV_SYSID_GCS_HI

MAV_OPTIONS.Description: Alters various behaviour of the MAVLink interface

MAV_SYSID.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network.
MAV_SYSID.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

MAV_TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

MAV1_EXTRA1.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of ATTITUDE, SIMSTATE (SIM only), AHRS2, RPM, AOA_SSA, LANDING,ESC_TELEMETRY,EFI_STATUS, and PID_TUNING

MAV1_EXTRA3.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of AHRS, SYSTEM_TIME, WIND, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, TERRAIN_REQUEST, TERRAIN_REPORT, GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION, and BATTERY_STATUS

MAV1_EXT_STAT.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SYS_STATUS, POWER_STATUS, MCU_STATUS, MEMINFO, CURRENT_WAYPOINT, GPS_RAW_INT, GPS_RTK (if available), GPS2_RAW_INT (if available), GPS2_RTK (if available), NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, FENCE_STATUS, and GLOBAL_TARGET_POS_INT

Bitmask.3: forward mavlink packets that don't pass CRC

MAV1_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask for configuring this telemetry channel. For having effect on all channels, set the relevant mask in all MAVx_OPTIONS parameters. Keep in mind that part of the flags may require a reboot to take action.
MAV1_OPTIONS.DisplayName: Bitmask for configuring this telemetry channel

MAV1_POSITION.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED

MAV1_RAW_CTRL.Description: MAVLink Raw Control stream rate of SERVO_OUT

MAV1_RAW_SENS.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, SCALED_PRESSURE3 and AIRSPEED

MAV1_RC_CHAN.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS

MAV10_EXTRA1.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of ATTITUDE, SIMSTATE (SIM only), AHRS2, RPM, AOA_SSA, LANDING,ESC_TELEMETRY,EFI_STATUS, and PID_TUNING

MAV10_EXTRA3.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of AHRS, SYSTEM_TIME, WIND, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, TERRAIN_REQUEST, TERRAIN_REPORT, GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION, and BATTERY_STATUS

MIS_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask of what options to use in missions. If the DontZeroCounter counter option is set than on completion of a jump loop the counter is left at zero, so the jump will not happen again if the loop is re-entered.

MIS_RESTART.Description: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)
MIS_RESTART.DisplayName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode

MIS_TOTAL.Description: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

MNT1_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT1_DEVID.Description: Mount device ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

MNT1_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Servo mount pitch angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current pitch rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT1_LEAD_RLL.Description: Servo mount roll angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current roll rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT1_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT1_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT1_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position

Bitmask.0: RC lock state from previous mode
Bitmask.1: Return to neutral angles on RC failsafe
Bitmask.2: Force FPV (bf) lock on roll and pitch

MNT1_OPTIONS.Description: Mount options bitmask, note bit 2 only impacts RC targetting mode

MNT1_RC_RATE.Description: Pilot rate control's maximum rate.  Set to zero to use angle control

MNT1_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT1_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT1_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position

MNT1_SYSID_DFLT.Description: Default Target sysID for the mount to point to

MNT2_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT2_DEVID.Description: Mount device ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

MNT2_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Servo mount pitch angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current pitch rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT2_LEAD_RLL.Description: Servo mount roll angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current roll rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position

Bitmask.0: RC lock state from previous mode
Bitmask.1: Return to neutral angles on RC failsafe
Bitmask.2: Force FPV (bf) lock on roll and pitch

MNT2_OPTIONS.Description: Mount options bitmask, note bit 2 only impacts RC targetting mode

MNT2_RC_RATE.Description: Pilot rate control's maximum rate.  Set to zero to use angle control

MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position

MNT2_SYSID_DFLT.Description: Default Target sysID for the mount to point to

MOT_10_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_11_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_12_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_1_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_2_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_3_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_4_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_5_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_6_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_7_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_8_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_9_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX.Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

MOT_BAT_CURR_TC.Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

MOT_BAT_IDX.Description: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX.Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN.Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_BOOST_SCALE.Description: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle.  The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

MOT_FV_CPLNG_K.Description: Used to decouple pitch from forward/vertical motion. 0 to disable, 1.2 normal

MOT_HOVER_LEARN.Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

MOT_PWM_MAX.Description: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

MOT_PWM_MIN.Description: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

MOT_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output.PWMRange and PWMAngle are PWM special/rare cases for ESCs that dont calibrate normally (some Sub motors) or where each ESC must have its PWM range set individually using the Servo params instead of PWM_MIN/MAX parameters.

MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed

MOT_SAFE_TIME.Description: Delay after arming before spool transitions are allowed, used to let ESCs/servos complete startup when PWM was disabled while disarmed.
MOT_SAFE_TIME.DisplayName: PWM re-enable delay after arming when disarmed pwm was disabled

MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change.  Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle

MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for increasing throttle

MOT_SPIN_ARM.Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

MOT_SPIN_MAX.Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

MOT_SPIN_MIN.Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

MOT_SPOOL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

MOT_SPOOL_TIM_DN.Description: Time to ramp the throttle ceiling down toward zero. If 0, SPOOL_TIME is used.

MOT_THST_EXPO.Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

MOT_THST_HOVER.Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

MOT_YAW_HEADROOM.Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

MSP_OPTIONS.Description: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options: EnableTelemetryMode-allows "push" mode telemetry when only rx line of OSD ic connected to autopilot,  EnableBTFLFonts-uses indexes corresponding to Betaflight fonts if OSD uses those instead of ArduPilot fonts. EnableINAVFonts uses INAV fonts and overrides EnableBTFLFonts if that option is enabled.

MSP_OSD_NCELLS.Description: Used for average cell voltage calculation

NET_NETMASK.Description: Allows setting static subnet mask. The value is a count of consecutive bits. Examples: 24 = 255.255.255.0, 16 = 255.255.0.0

NET_P1_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NET_P2_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NET_P3_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NET_P4_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NMEA_MSG_EN.Description: This is a bitmask of enabled NMEA messages. All messages will be sent consecutively at the same rate interval

NMEA_RATE_MS.Description: NMEA Output rate. This controls the interval at which all the enabled NMEA messages are sent. Most NMEA systems expect 100ms (10Hz) or slower.

NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL.Description: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

NTF_BUZZ_PIN.Description: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET! Some the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

NTF_BUZZ_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME.Description: Control the volume of the buzzer

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_LEN.Description: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED.  OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.
NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.DisplayName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed

NTF_LED_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled

NTF_OREO_THEME.Description: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

OSD_ARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on Arm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_BTN_DELAY.Description: Debounce time in ms for stick commanded parameter navigation.

OSD_CELL_COUNT.Description: Used for average cell voltage display. -1 disables, 0 uses cell count autodetection for well charged LIPO/LIION batteries at connection, other values manually select cell count used.

OSD_CHAN.Description: This sets the channel used to switch different OSD screens.

OSD_DSARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on disarm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_FONT.Description: This sets which OSD font to use. It is an integer from 0 to the number of fonts available

OSD_FS_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on failsafe event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_H_OFFSET.Description: Sets horizontal offset of the osd inside image

Bitmask.3: Convert feet to miles at 5280ft instead of 10000ft

OSD_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options that change the display

OSD_SB_H_OFS.Description: Extends the spacing between the sidebar elements by this amount of columns. Positive values increases the width to the right of the screen.

OSD_SB_V_EXT.Description: Increase of vertical length of the sidebar itens by this amount of lines. Applied equally both above and below the default setting.

OSD_SW_METHOD.Description: This sets the method used to switch different OSD screens.

Values.0: switch to next screen if channel value was changed
Values.1: select screen based on pwm ranges specified for each screen
Values.2: switch to next screen after low to high transition and every 1s while channel value is high

OSD_TYPE.Description: OSD type. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

OSD_TYPE2.Description: OSD type 2. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

OSD_UNITS.Description: Sets the units to use in displaying items

OSD_V_OFFSET.Description: Sets vertical offset of the osd inside image

OSD_W_ACRVOLT.Description: Set level at which ACRVOLT item will flash
OSD_W_ACRVOLT.DisplayName: Avg Cell Resting Volt warn level

OSD_W_AVGCELLV.Description: Set level at which AVGCELLV item will flash

OSD_W_BATVOLT.Description: Set level at which BAT_VOLT item will flash

OSD_W_LQ.Description: Set level at which RC_LQ item will flash (%)

OSD_W_NSAT.Description: Set level at which NSAT item will flash

OSD_W_RESTVOLT.Description: Set level at which RESTVOLT item will flash

OSD_W_RSSI.Description: Set level at which RSSI item will flash (in positive % or negative dBm values as applicable). 30% or -100dBm are defaults.

OSD_W_SNR.Description: Set level at which RC_SNR item will flash (in db)

OSD_W_TERR.Description: Set level below which TER_HGT item will flash. -1 disables.

OSD1_ACRVOLT_EN.Description: Displays resting voltage for the average cell. WARNING: this can be inaccurate if the cell count is not detected or set properly. If the  the battery is far from fully charged the detected cell count might not be accurate if auto cell count detection is used (OSD_CELL_COUNT=0).

OSD1_ASPD1_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from primary airspeed sensor

OSD1_ASPD2_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from secondary airspeed sensor

OSD1_ASPEED_EN.Description: Displays airspeed value being used by TECS (fused value)

OSD1_ATEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary airspeed sensor

OSD1_AVGCELLV_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage. WARNING: this can be inaccurate if the cell count is not detected or set properly. If the  the battery is far from fully charged the detected cell count might not be accurate if auto cell count detection is used (OSD_CELL_COUNT=0).

OSD1_BATTBAR_EN.Description: Displays battery usage bar (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_BTEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by secondary barometer

OSD1_CALLSIGN_EN.Description: Displays callsign from callsign.txt on microSD card

OSD1_CELLVOLT_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CHAN_MAX.Description: This sets the PWM upper limit for this screen

OSD1_CHAN_MIN.Description: This sets the PWM lower limit for this screen

OSD1_CLK_EN.Description: Displays a clock panel based on AP_RTC local time

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_EN.Description: Displays artificial horizon crosshair (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_ESCAMPS_EN.Description: Displays the current of the ESC with the highest rpm of all active ESCs, or of a specific ESC if OSDx_ESC_IDX is set

OSD1_ESCRPM_EN.Description: Displays highest rpm of all active ESCs, or of a specific ESC if OSDx_ESC_IDX is set

OSD1_ESCTEMP_EN.Description: Displays highest temp of all active ESCs, or of a specific ECS if OSDx_ESC_IDX is set

OSD1_ESC_IDX.Description: Index of the ESC to use for displaying ESC information. 0 means use the ESC with the highest value.

OSD1_FENCE_EN.Description: Displays indication of fence enable and breach

OSD1_FONT.Description: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD1_FONT.DisplayName: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD1_HOMEDIR_EN.Description: Displays relative direction to HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_EN.Description: Displays distance from HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOME_EN.Description: Displays distance and relative direction to HOME

OSD1_PITCH_EN.Description: Displays degrees of pitch from level

OSD1_RC_ANT_EN.Description: Displays the current RC link active antenna

OSD1_RC_PWR_EN.Description: Displays the RC link transmit (TX) power in mW or W, depending on level

OSD1_RC_SNR_EN.Description: Displays RC link signal to noise ratio in dB

OSD1_RNGF_EN.Description: Displays a rangefinder's distance in cm

OSD1_ROLL_EN.Description: Displays degrees of roll from level

OSD1_RSSIDBM_EN.Description: Displays RC link signal strength in dBm

OSD1_TEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary barometer

OSD1_THROTTLE_EN.Description: Displays actual throttle percentage being sent to motor(s)

PRX_FILT.Description: Cutoff frequency for low pass filter applied to each face in the proximity boundary

PRX_LOG_RAW.Description: Set this parameter to one if logging unfiltered(raw) distances from sensor should be enabled

PRX1_ADDR.Description: The bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

PRX1_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

PRX2_ADDR.Description: The bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.
